db module

db.authenticate_user(email, password)[source]

Authenticates a user based on email and password.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • password (str) – The password of the user.

Returns:

Returns True if authentication is successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

db.clear_chats(email)[source]

Clears the chat history of a user from the database.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user.

Returns:

None

db.create_user(new_name, new_email, new_date, new_password) → int[source]

Creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • new_name (str) – The name of the new user.

  • new_email (str) – The email of the new user.

  • new_date (str) – The date of birth of the new user.

  • new_password (str) – The password for the new user.

Returns:

Returns 0 if the user already exists, 1 if the user is created successfully.

Return type:

int

db.delete_acc(email, password)[source]

Deletes a user account from the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • password (str) – The password of the user.

Returns:

Returns 1 if the account is deleted successfully, 0 if the credentials are invalid.

Return type:

int

db.get_user_queries(email)[source]

Retrieves the queries of a user from the database.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user.

Returns:

A dictionary of user queries with sanitized keys.

Return type:

dict

db.getname(email)[source]

Retrieves the name of a user from the database.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user.

Returns:

The name of the user.

Return type:

str

db.update_user(new_email, new_date, new_password) → int[source]

Updates the password of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • new_email (str) – The email of the user.

  • new_date (str) – The date of birth of the user.

  • new_password (str) – The new password for the user.

Returns:

Returns 0 if the user does not exist, 1 if the credentials are invalid,

and 2 if the password is updated successfully.

Return type:

int

db.update_user_queries(username, queries)[source]

Updates the queries of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username (email) of the user.

  • queries (dict) – A dictionary of queries to update.

Returns:

None
